intro: Iboga vateriana, commonly known as the African iboga, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that contain the psychoactive alkaloid ibogaine, which has been traditionally used in spiritual and medicinal practices. Iboga vateriana thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
